intro: Urostigma alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf urostigma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its alternate leaf arrangement and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is known for its woody stems and simple, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
